intro: Amyema tetraflora, commonly known as the four-flowered amyema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in groups of four, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. Amyema tetraflora is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
